main event: A balloon-shaped object descended upon the Stockton Naval Supply Depot in Stockton, California on January 1, 1951.
interesting points: The object was red and green in color.
The object exploded upon hitting the ground, but a part of it remained and burned fiercely until extinguished by naval security guards.
The residue was recovered and sent to the FBI laboratory for examination.
Analysis suggested the object was a home-made 'toy air' balloon, possibly of tropical or oriental construction.
The FBI concluded the object was the remains of a Japanese balloon attached to a small paper container and some wire.
sighted object: A red and green balloon-shaped object
